issue.title: CI: Add ci for VS/msvc build
issue.body:
This add ci test for code generated by msvc. 

The full detail is [here](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider/pull/256#issuecomment-1727750617)

It captured a new error by the test msvc_native:
```
test 4
    Start 4: oqs_tlssig

4: Test command: D:\dev\src\oqs-provider\_build\test\Debug\oqs_test_tlssig.exe "oqsprovider" "D:/dev/src/oqs-provider/test/openssl-ca.cnf" "D:/dev/src/oqs-provider/_build/test/tmp"
4: Working Directory: D:/dev/src/oqs-provider/_build
4: Environment variables:
4:  OPENSSL_MODULES=D:/dev/src/oqs-provider/_build/lib
4:  OPENSSL_CONF=D:/dev/src/oqs-provider/test/openssl-ca.cnf
4: Test timeout computed to be: 10000000
4: OPENSSL_Uplink(00007FFB1067CFE8,08): no OPENSSL_Applink
4/5 Test #4: oqs_tlssig .......................***Failed    0.02 sec
OPENSSL_Uplink(00007FFB1067CFE8,08): no OPENSSL_Applink

test 5
    Start 5: oqs_endecode

5: Test command: D:\dev\src\oqs-provider\_build\test\Debug\oqs_test_endecode.exe "oqsprovider" "D:/dev/src/oqs-provider/test/openssl-ca.cnf"
5: Working Directory: D:/dev/src/oqs-provider/_build/test
5: Environment variables:
5:  OPENSSL_MODULES=D:/dev/src/oqs-provider/_build/lib
5:  OPENSSL_CONF=D:/dev/src/oqs-provider/test/openssl-ca.cnf
5: Test timeout computed to be: 10000000
5: OPENSSL_Uplink(00007FFB1067CFE8,08): no OPENSSL_Applink
5/5 Test #5: oqs_endecode .....................***Failed    0.02 sec
OPENSSL_Uplink(00007FFB1067CFE8,08): no OPENSSL_Applink


0% tests passed, 5 tests failed out of 5
```

All the tests have the same error

comment.body: What also makes me wonder: Why does MSVC-2019 pass and 2022 fail?

issue.title: updated (O)IDs for interop test branch
issue.body:
This updates (O)IDs pursuant the `liboqs` changes to Kyber and Dilithium in the "standard" branch as discussed in https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/pull/1537#issuecomment-1729399245.

Documentation generation excluded due to an upstream problem.

comment.body:
> Am I missing something?

No -- I missed to change this test to move off `liboqs` "main" to "standard". Now fixed. Good to merge (if you're fine with the IDs chosen).

comment.body:
> What also makes me wonder: Why does MSVC-2019 pass and 2022 fail?

That's the output of ci building liboqs for Windows 2019 with Visual Studio 16 2019
```
"D:\a\oqs-provider\oqs-provider\liboqs\build\INSTALL.vcxproj" (default target) (1) ->
"D:\a\oqs-provider\oqs-provider\liboqs\build\ALL_BUILD.vcxproj" (default target) (3) ->
"D:\a\oqs-provider\oqs-provider\liboqs\build\src\common\common.vcxproj" (default target) (4) ->
(ClCompile target) -> 
  C:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\10\Include\10.0.17763.0\um\oaidl.h(487,17): error C2059: syntax error: '/' [D:\a\oqs-provider\oqs-provider\liboqs\build\src\common\common.vcxproj]
  C:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\10\Include\10.0.17763.0\um\oaidl.h(502,17): error C2059: syntax error: '/' [D:\a\oqs-provider\oqs-provider\liboqs\build\src\common\common.vcxproj]
  C:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\10\Include\10.0.17763.0\um\oaidl.h(530,17): error C2059: syntax error: '}' [D:\a\oqs-provider\oqs-provider\liboqs\build\src\common\common.vcxproj]
  C:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\10\Include\10.0.17763.0\um\oaidl.h(531,13): error C2059: syntax error: '}' [D:\a\oqs-provider\oqs-provider\liboqs\build\src\common\common.vcxproj]
  C:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\10\Include\10.0.17763.0\um\oaidl.h(533,9): error C2059: syntax error: '}' [D:\a\oqs-provider\oqs-provider\liboqs\build\src\common\common.vcxproj]

  C:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\10\Include\10.0.17763.0\um\oaidl.h(665,16): error C2079: 'varDefaultValue' uses undefined struct 'tagVARIANT' [D:\a\oqs-provider\oqs-provider\liboqs\build\src\common\common.vcxproj]

  C:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\10\Include\10.0.17763.0\um\propidlbase.h(380,5): error C2059: syntax error: '}' [D:\a\oqs-provider\oqs-provider\liboqs\build\src\common\common.vcxproj]
  C:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\10\Include\10.0.17763.0\um\propidlbase.h(383,3): error C2059: syntax error: '}' [D:\a\oqs-provider\oqs-provider\liboqs\build\src\common\common.vcxproj]

  C:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\10\Include\10.0.17763.0\um\oaidl.h(950,16): error C2079: 'varValue' uses undefined struct 'tagVARIANT' [D:\a\oqs-provider\oqs-provider\liboqs\build\src\common\common.vcxproj]
  C:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\10\Include\10.0.17763.0\um\propidlbase.h(319,24): error C2059: syntax error: '/' [D:\a\oqs-provider\oqs-provider\liboqs\build\src\common\common.vcxproj]
  C:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\10\Include\10.0.17763.0\um\propidlbase.h(378,37): error C2371: 'pvarVal': redefinition; different basic types [D:\a\oqs-provider\oqs-provider\liboqs\build\src\common\common.vcxproj]
  C:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\10\Include\10.0.17763.0\um\propidlbase.h(379,9): error C2059: syntax error: '}' [D:\a\oqs-provider\oqs-provider\liboqs\build\src\common\common.vcxproj]
  C:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\10\Include\10.0.17763.0\um\propidlbase.h(380,5): error C2059: syntax error: '}' [D:\a\oqs-provider\oqs-provider\liboqs\build\src\common\common.vcxproj]
  C:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\10\Include\10.0.17763.0\um\propidlbase.h(383,3): error C2059: syntax error: '}' [D:\a\oqs-provider\oqs-provider\liboqs\build\src\common\common.vcxproj]
  C:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\10\Include\10.0.17763.0\um\propidlbase.h(384,1): error C2059: syntax error: '}' [D:\a\oqs-provider\oqs-provider\liboqs\build\src\common\common.vcxproj]
```

In this [post](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/15734367/error-c2059-syntax-error-when-adding-c-source-files-to-project), it may arise from the lack support of C99 initialization style (designated initializers) in VS 16 2017.
As shown in [table](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/cpp/overview/visual-cpp-language-conformance?view=msvc-160#c-standard-library-features-1): The [Designated initialization](https://wg21.link/p0329r4) is supported in VS 2019 16.1.

issue.title: Fix OQS_ADDL_SOCKET_LIBS setting for cmake
issue.body:
This fixes the cmake flag so it generates the right lib dependencies for msvc build. Otherwise, ths VS would complain about:
**LINK : fatal error LNK1104: cannot open file 'ws2_32.lib gdi32.lib crypt32.lib'**

comment.body:
> Conclusion:
> [Not final solution](https://github.com/qnfm/oqs-provider/blob/msvc_ci/.github/workflows/windows.yml)

Please let me know when I should take another look.


comment.body:
Updated:
The liboqs build error was [fixed ](https://github.com/qnfm/liboqs/blob/ccebcfae2b82b2e08c3f4d0cffdb7748cb1b421c/.CMake/compiler_opts.cmake)by enabling C11 standard option in cmake files.
```
add_compile_options(/std:c11)
```

issue.title: build: Align VS test folder with all other Generators
issue.body:
This aligns the output folder for tests much like other platforms.

Fixes #1555

* [ ] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [ ] Does this PR change the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming? Does this PR otherwise change an API? (If so, PRs in [oqs-provider](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider), [OQS-OpenSSL](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssl), [OQS-BoringSSL](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/boringssl), and [OQS-OpenSSH](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssh) will also need to be ready for review and merge by the time this is merged.)

<!-- Once your pull request is ready for review and passing continuous integration tests, please convert from a draft PR to a normal PR, and request a review from one of the OQS core team members. -->

issue.title: CI & cmake changes
issue.body:
Fully implement CI jobs for building under VS environment
Align the cmake test file with the VS generator.

NB: The ci change in this commit rely on my pr branch #256. I'm not sure whether should I make pr directly or just wait upstream to merged #256 then make this pr.

comment.body:
> > NB: The ci change in this commit rely on my pr branch #256. I'm not sure whether should I make pr directly or just wait upstream to merged #256 then make this pr.
> 
> I'm not quite sure what you mean: Does #263 add to & improve the changes in #256? If so, we could simply close #256 and only merge #263, right? I was holding back #256 because of your final comment "Not final solution".
> 
> Otherwise things LGTM with two single comments where I'd appreciate feedback to properly understand things. Also waiting for CI to complete. Thanks very much for this work!
